medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. T experienced a lifelong struggle with eating, becoming increasingly restricted in his food intake over the recent months. He lost 10 lb during the 2 months before admission, became guarded and secretive about meals, and developed poor appetite and caloric intake, with his limited diet further restricted to single food items. Symptoms worsened significantly pre-admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with William’s syndrome at 6 weeks of age; required surgical repair of pectus excavatum and supravalvar aortic stenosis by age 19; history of moderate aortic regurgitation, delayed gastric emptying.
medical_history.family_history: Mother described intermittent depressive symptoms, but no other acknowledged family history of psychiatric or substance use disorder. No family history of William’s syndrome.
medical_history.social_history: Mr. T has lived with his parents his whole life and has limited social interactions, primarily attending dances for developmentally disabled children with parental accompaniment.
